article_title: The Odds Rise of a Democratic Victory
article_text:
While all eyes have been turned toward the dramatic nominating contests in both political parties, the fundamentals that will shape the general-election contest have been shifting toward the Democrats.

Candidates seeking to succeed a two-term incumbent of their own party face an uphill battle. All other things being equal, political scientists find, such candidates can expect to fall short of the incumbents’ re-election vote share by...

twitter.description: Politics & Ideas columnist William Galston writes that the odds are rising for a Democrat presidential victory in the fall. The U.S. economy and Obama’s approval rating are improving—bad signs for the GOP.
twitter.title: The Odds Rise of a Democratic Victory

All other things being equal, political scientists find, such candidates can expect to fall short of the incumbents’ re-election vote share by...
Candidates seeking to succeed a two-term incumbent of their own party face an uphill battle.
While all eyes have been turned toward the dramatic nominating contests in both political parties, the fundamentals that will shape the general-election contest have been shifting toward the Democrats.
